oai_dc:dc.dc:title: THE IMPACTS OF A MANGROVE PATCH ON WAVE PRESSURES ON THE SEA DIKE
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Zhang, Rong
Lei, Jiaxin
Chen, Yongping
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Incorporating nature-based solutions with traditional hard coastal structures, serving as a hybrid coastal protection solution that encapsulates both hazard mitigation and ecological sustainability, is becoming popular. In this study, the non-hydrostatic model SWASH was employed to simulate the impacts of a mangrove patch on the sea dike. Through setting up comparative experiments with and without mangroves in front of the sea dike, the effects of mangroves on the wave height evolution in front of the sea dike and the variations of wave pressures on the sea dike were analyzed. The study indicates that the Goda formula cannot accurately estimate the impact loads on the vertical sea dike. Mangroves situated in front of the sea dike can significantly reduce the approached wave heights as well as the wave pressures on the sea dike. The maximum wave pressure on the vertical sea dike increases with the increase of wave steepness and Ursell number and decreases as the relative water depth increases.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 38 (2024): Proceedings of 38th Conference on Coastal Engineering, Rome, Italy, 2024; structures.117
